critique: The document aims to inspire confidence and hope by addressing unemployment and promoting economic recovery. The tone is formal and authoritative, reflecting the President's role in leading the nation through a crisis. The actions described, such as establishing the Export-Import Bank, are intended to foster economic growth and stability. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are joy (related to economic recovery and job creation), and surprise (related to the innovative measures being taken). There might be some sadness related to the acknowledgement of the existing national emergency. Fear and disgust are less relevant in this context, but there might be a slight element of fear related to the ongoing crisis that the President is trying to alleviate.
